title: Group Effect Enhanced Generative Adversarial Imitation Learning for Individual Travel Behavior Modeling under Incentives
summary: This paper focuses on understanding and modeling individual travel behavior responses, addressing challenges of data quantity and spatial-temporal coverage in dynamic travel behavior modeling using a Markov decision process framework.
usefulness_reason: The summary explicitly mentions "spatial-temporal coverage" in the context of "individual travel behavior modeling," which is highly relevant to spatio-temporal data. Travel behavior can often be modeled as point processes in space and time.
